snippet: A 65-year-old man died after his boat was fired on by a Philippine government ship after coast guard officials said his boat had tried to ram the Philippine vessel.
abstract: Taiwan and mainland China react with anger over death of Taiwanese fisherman who was fatally shot when Philippine Coast Guard opened fire on his boat, saying it had tried to ram a Philippine ship.

byline.contributor: Keith Bradsher contributed reporting from Hong Kong.

lead_paragraph: A 65-year-old man died after his boat was fired on by a Philippine government ship after coast guard officials said his boat had tried to ram the Philippine vessel.

headline.seo: Taiwan Demands Apology  for Killing of Fisherman
headline.main: Taiwan Demands Philippine Apology for Fisherman’s Killing
headline.print_headline: Taiwan Demands Philippine Apology for Fisherman’s Killing
